articles.title: Ancient Sahul's submerged landscapes reveal a mosaic of human habitation - Phys.org
articles.description: New research conducted by a team of archaeologists and Earth scientists has shed light on the ancient landscapes of Sahul, the Pleistocene (Ice Age) landmass comprising Australia and New Guinea.
articles.content:

articles.title: 19-million-year-old fossil jaw bone hints the biggest whales first evolved somewhere unexpected - The Conversation
articles.description: A newly described fossil from South Australia is making waves in our understanding of where and when whales evolved titanic body sizes.
articles.content: Baleen whales are the titans of the ocean, the largest animals to have ever lived. The record holder is the blue whale (Balaenoptera musculus), which can reach lengths of up to 30 metres. Thats longe… [+5425 chars]
